unnormalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**
normalised: **Smart Meter Rollout Gathers Momentum in Maharashtra**

unnormalised: Mumbai, 27/10/2023 - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (MSEDCL) is accelerating its smart meter installation drive across the state. As part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (RDSS), the project aims to replace conventional meters with smart meters for all consumers by 2025.
normalised: Mumbai, twenty seventh October two thousand and twenty three - The Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Limited (M S E D C L) is accelerating its smart meter installation drive across the state. As part of the Revamped Distribution Sector Scheme (R D S S), the project aims to replace conventional meters with smart meters for all consumers by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The initial phase targets urban centers like Pune and Nagpur, with installation commencing in select areas at 10:00 hrs tomorrow. These smart meters will enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, facilitating efficient grid management and reducing Aggregate Technical & Commercial (AT&C) losses, currently estimated at Rs. 20,000 Crore annually for MSEDCL.
normalised: The initial phase targets urban centers like Pune and Nagpur, with installation commencing in select areas at ten o'clock tomorrow. These smart meters will enable real-time monitoring of electricity consumption, facilitating efficient grid management and reducing Aggregate Technical and Commercial (A T and C) losses, currently estimated at rupees twenty billion annually for M S E D C L.

unnormalised: "This is a crucial step towards modernizing our energy infrastructure," stated Mr. Patil, Chairman of MSEDCL, during a press briefing earlier today. The smart meters also empower consumers with detailed consumption data, allowing them to make informed choices and potentially save on their electricity bills. Data will be available via a dedicated app accessible from 15/11/2023. The long-term plan includes integrating renewable energy sources more effectively and strengthening grid stability, especially crucial in rural areas lacking robust infrastructure even after 76 years of Independence. Further updates are expected at 14:30 hrs next week.
